Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Dispute_Type: Judicial review followed by civil lawsuit
Legal_Provision_Involved: Rule 221(1)(a) of the Rules of Civil Procedure
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness by CSC representatives
Legal_Framework: Tort law, Misfeasance in public office
Evidence_Requirement: Specific facts demonstrating deliberate and unlawful conduct with awareness of harm
Decision_Outcome: Statement of Claim dismissed without leave to amend
Institutional_Action: CSC representatives' actions challenged for bad faith and unlawfulness
Individual_Status_or_Claim: Plaintiff alleging harm from public officer misconduct
Nature_of_Participation: Plaintiff as claimant against public officials
Legal_Statute: Common law tort of misfeasance in public office
Assessment_Standard: Pleading must disclose material facts, not bare assertions
Complaint_Issues: Unlawful conduct, bad faith, procedural unfairness
Legal_Standard: Deliberate and unlawful conduct with knowledge of unlawfulness and likely harm
Risk_Factor: Harm to plaintiff from misuse of public office
Credibility: Allegations found speculative and lacking particularization
Legal_Provision: Tort of misfeasance in public office
Risk_Nature: Likelihood of harm due to unlawful official conduct
Enforcement_Action: Motion to strike under procedural rules
Victim_Basis: Alleged victim of misuse of public office
